FuncDef:
The peer route-policy export command specifies a route-policy for filtering routes to be advertised to a peer.
The undo peer route-policy export command deletes a specified route-policy. The peer route-policy export command specifies a route-policy for filtering routes to be advertised to a peer. The undo peer route-policy export command deletes a specified route-policy. By default, no route-policy is configured for the routes to be advertised to a specified BGP peer.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a route-policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters without spaces.

Applies a route-policy to the routes to be advertised to a peer.
-

ExtraInfo: After a route-policy is created, the peer route-policy export command is used to apply a Route-Policy to a peer so that the routes advertised to the peer can be controlled. To be specific, only the necessary routes are advertised to the peer. In this manner, route management is implemented, the scale of the routing table is reduced, and fewer network resources are consumed.
